cppcoreguidelines-pro-type-cstyle-cast.description:
Description

This check flags all use of C-style casts that perform a
static_cast
downcast,
const_cast
, or
reinterpret_cast
.

Use of these casts can violate type safety and cause the program to access a
variable that is actually of type X to be accessed as if it were of an
unrelated type Z. Note that a C-style
(T)expression
cast means to perform
the first of the following that is possible: a
const_cast
, a
static_cast
, a
static_cast
followed by a
const_cast
, a
reinterpret_cast
, or a
reinterpret_cast
followed by a
const_cast
.
This rule bans
(T)expression
only when used to perform an unsafe cast.

This rule is part of the
Type safety (Type.4)
profile from the C++ Core Guidelines.
cppcoreguidelines-pro-type-cstyle-cast.option:
Static analysis (Clang-Tidy) options are configured via .clang-tidy file.

This rule has no specific options.
